title: Neanderthal
summary: Neanderthals (/niˈændərˌtɑːl, neɪ-, -ˌθɑːl/,[7] also Neandertals, Homo neanderthalensis or Homo sapiens neanderthalensis)[8] are an extinct species or subspecies of archaic humans who lived in Eurasia until about 40,000 years ago.[9][10][11][12] They most likely went extinct due to assimilation into the modern human genome (bred into extinction),[13] great climatic change,[14][15][16] disease,[17][18] or a combination of these factors.[16]
